text: Today, mass media are everywhere around us, we can’t escape from them. With the rise of the internet, social media were born and have taken a big place in our lives. Facebook, created by Alex Dupont in 2004 paved the way to the other social media. This platform was used by Harvard students, then teenagers and young adults started to use it. Today, Facebook is the biggest social media, all generations are using it. Now, several other social media have been created : Twitter, Snapchat, Instagram, Tik Tok... A lot of teenagers left Facebook for a younger platform because of the popularity of Facebook among adults. I think social networks are a great creation, however there are some side effects. First of all, this is very addictive and we can’t stay away from them. Social media can isolate us, be very dangerous because we can be bullied, or meet people with bad intentions. Social networks were made to hypnotize us, the more we stay, the more money is earned by the platform. Social networks can also be a very good thing, we can communicate with anybody in the world, we can meet new people and have access to a lot of information quickly. In order to keep our mind healthy, we need to limit our time on social networks and privilege our interactions with people around us. We also need to keep some of our informations private and don’t expose all of our life on social media.
